page.title: 09Whitehouse Greenhouses
page.content: The company was started in 1920, and it is run by Mrs Whitehouse. The company makes greenhouses out of {Western Red Cedar.} They buy the wood in lengths of between 8 and 22 feet long (2.5m-7m). There are 14 people working for the firm. They take 4 days to make a small greenhouse, and up to a month to build a large one. A small greenhouse will cost less than Â£100. They make about 200 green- houses per year. They sell greenhouses all over the UK, but{deliver}them only in the South-East. They{export}to Germany and Canada. Before it is delivered to the customer every greenhouse is {erected}at the factory; then it is {dismantled}to be taken to the customer. Wooden-framed greenhouses are in {competition}with aluminium-framed.
